intro: Scorzonera eriosperma, commonly known as the hairy scorzonera, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disc, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Scorzonera eriosperma is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its hardy nature and ability to attract pollinators.
